verses.kjv: Come down, and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon, sit on the ground: there is no throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called tender and delicate.
verses.ct: Get down and sit in the dirt, virgin daughter of Babylon. Sit on the ground — there is no throne for you anymore, daughter of the Chaldeans. No one will ever again call you pampered and refined.

verses.kjv: Take the millstones, and grind meal: uncover thy locks, make bare the leg, uncover the thigh, pass over the rivers.
verses.ct: Pick up the millstones and grind flour. Remove your veil, strip your legs bare, expose your thighs, and wade through the rivers.

verses.kjv: Thy nakedness shall be uncovered, yea, thy shame shall be seen: I will take vengeance, and I will not meet thee as a man.
verses.ct: Your body will be exposed, and your disgrace will be on display. I will take my revenge, and no one will stand in my way.

verses.kjv: As for our redeemer, the LORD of hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: Our redeemer — the LORD of hosts is his name — the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: Sit thou silent, and get thee into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called, The lady of kingdoms.
verses.ct: Sit in silence and disappear into the darkness, daughter of the Chaldeans, because no one will ever again call you the queen of kingdoms.

verses.kjv: I was wroth with my people, I have polluted mine inheritance, and given them into thine hand: thou didst shew them no mercy; upon the ancient hast thou very heavily laid thy yoke.
verses.ct: I was angry with my people. I let my own inheritance be dishonored and handed them over to you. But you showed them no mercy — even on the elderly you placed an unbearably heavy burden.

verses.kjv: And thou saidst, I shall be a lady for ever: so that thou didst not lay these things to thy heart, neither didst remember the latter end of it.
verses.ct: You said, 'I will be queen forever.' You never took these things to heart or considered how it would all end.

verses.kjv: Therefore hear now this, thou that art given to pleasures, that dwellest carelessly, that sayest in thine heart, I am, and none else beside me; I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall I know the loss of children:
verses.ct: So listen now, you who are devoted to pleasure, you who live without a care, you who tell yourself, 'I am supreme, and there is no one else like me. I will never become a widow, and I will never lose my children.'

verses.kjv: But these two things shall come to thee in a moment in one day, the loss of children, and widowhood: they shall come upon thee in their perfection for the multitude of thy sorceries, and for the great abundance of thine enchantments.
verses.ct: But both of these disasters will hit you suddenly, in a single day — the loss of your children and widowhood. They will come upon you in full measure, despite all your sorcery and the overwhelming power of your spells.

verses.kjv: For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness: thou hast said, None seeth me. Thy wisdom and thy knowledge, it hath perverted thee; and thou hast said in thine heart, I am, and none else beside me.
verses.ct: You put your confidence in your own wickedness. You told yourself, 'No one sees me.' Your wisdom and your knowledge twisted you, and you said in your heart, 'I am supreme, and there is no one else like me.'

verses.kjv: Therefore shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from whence it riseth: and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be able to put it off: and desolation shall come upon thee suddenly, which thou shalt not know.
verses.ct: But disaster will strike you, and you won't know where it came from. Trouble will fall on you that you cannot ward off. Devastation will crash down on you suddenly — something you never anticipated.

verses.kjv: Stand now with thine enchantments, and with the multitude of thy sorceries, wherein thou hast laboured from thy youth; if so be thou shalt be able to profit, if so be thou mayest prevail.
verses.ct: Go ahead — keep relying on your spells and your many acts of sorcery that you've practiced since you were young. Maybe they'll help you. Maybe you'll manage to succeed.

verses.kjv: Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels. Let now the astrologers, the stargazers, the monthly prognosticators, stand up, and save thee from these things that shall come upon thee.
verses.ct: You've exhausted yourself with all your advisors. Let your astrologers come forward now — those who study the stars, those who make predictions month by month — let them stand up and rescue you from what is coming.

verses.kjv: Behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver themselves from the power of the flame: there shall not be a coal to warm at, nor fire to sit before it.
verses.ct: Look, they will be like dry straw — fire will consume them. They won't even be able to save themselves from the flames. This won't be a warm coal to sit beside or a cozy fire to enjoy.

verses.kjv: Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured, even thy merchants, from thy youth: they shall wander every one to his quarter; none shall save thee.
verses.ct: That is what will become of those you've done business with, the merchants you've traded with since your youth. Each one will wander off in their own direction, and not a single one will save you.
